alert.note: Alert for Catahoula; Concordia (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 17 at 1:30AM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Concordia and Catahoula Parishes through 215 AM CDT... At 130 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Manifest, or 23 miles north of Larto, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Jonesville and Wallace Ridge around 145 AM CDT. Wildsville around 150 AM CDT. Frogmore around 205 AM CDT. Lee Bayou around 210 AM CDT. Clayton around 215 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Harrisonburg and Sicily Island. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. High winds can bring down trees and large limbs resulting in serious injury or property damage. Exercise extreme caution when outdoors during such strong winds...and be especially aware of older trees.
